summary:
Holla out ya city if you'd ride for it Let 'em know why you'd die for it

 

And when the stash low and it ain't no cash flow...
body:
Holla out ya city if you’d ride for it
Let ‘em know why you’d die for it

And when the stash low and it ain’t no cash flow
Shit, I go to work, move it by the boat load 

Independent, semi-selective ‘V’ from Projekt Red’s Cyberpunk 2077. Hacked by Rose.

summary: Cyberpunk 2077 Will Let You Augment Yourself Too Far
title: Cyberpunk 2077 Will Let You Augment Yourself Too Far
body:
How far can we go in Cyberpunk 2077 in terms of cybernetic modifications? Will there be consequences to that?

One of the freedom’s that Cyberpunk 2077 is aiming to offer gamers isn’t just customization in terms of their players looks, but how far they transform their body from something of flesh, to something of machine. And as Quest Designer Patrick Willis told EDGE Magazine in an interview, you can do that in the game…but it comes with a cost.

“All the travails of the flesh fade away, and you become a perfect machine of chrome. But you had to buy those body parts from someone, and now you’re in debt to them; if you need parts, you’ve got to go to their store. You have this very utopian idea of being liberated by technology. And it’s like, not so fast–you haven’t solved the problems. The problems are still there, and technology actually makes them worse. ‘High tech, low life’ is one of Mike’s [Pondsmith, Cyberpunk 2020 creator] mottos.”

So push yourself as far as you want in the game, but don’t expect it to be an easy ride when you do.

Cyberpunk 2077 Will Let You Augment Yourself Too Far was originally published on MMORPG Forums

tags: its an interesting city for sure
title: Some Lore on Night City
body:
It’s located in the Free State of Northern California and has around 5 million inhabitants (by the year 2020)

It was founded by businessman Richard Night and his company Night International, whose end goal was to create the ideal city. Many megacorps invested heavily in its construction.

It was originally named Coronado City but was renamed Night City after Night’s death in 1998.

Its motto is “The City on the Edge of Tomorrow”.

In 2077, the city is controlled by the Corporations and the gangs. It has violent crime and extreme poverty. It was voted “the worst place to live in america”.
